alert.note: Alert for Clay; Wichita (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Jefferson, southern Garvin, southern Stephens, southern Cotton, northwestern Carter, southeastern Tillman, northwestern Clay and central Wichita Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 730 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Tatums to 3 miles west of Waurika to 7 miles west of Byers to 3 miles north of Iowa Park. Movement was west at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wichita Falls, Burkburnett, Waurika, Iowa Park, Comanche, Temple, Petrolia, Velma, Byers, Dean, Randlett, Tatums, Devol, Hastings, Loco, Ratliff City, Addington, Sugden, Waurika Lake and Sheppard AFB. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 0 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
